item.title: Spatial Autocorrelation
item.description: Load packages What is autocorrelation (spatial or temporal)? Autocorrelation is the measure of similarity (correlation) between nearby observations (in both time and space) Temporal The most recent event is related to the event before and after it set.seed(1234) randDat <- data.frame(x = sample(1:1000, 20)) randDat %>% mutate(x_1 = lead(x)) %>% filter(!is.na(x_1)) -> randDat ggplot(data = randDat) + geom_point(aes(x = x, y = x_1), size = 2) + labs(y = "x + 1") + theme_classic() cor(randDat$x, randDat$x_1) ## [1] 0.
